statement.p: A coffee distributor plans to mix some Gazebo coffee that sells for \displaystyle\${9.10} per pound with some House coffee that sells for \displaystyle\${13.40} per pound to create \displaystyle{70} pounds of a new coffee blend that will sell for \displaystyle\${10.82} per pound.
How many pounds of each kind of coffee should they mix? Round to the nearest pound. pounds of Gazebo coffee. pounds of House coffee.
